New Records: Jordan Walker had the first five-hit game by a Cardinal since teammate Matt Carpenter in 2018.
At 22 years, 102 days, Jordan Walker became the third-youngest Cardinal to get five hits in a game.
The Cardinals set season highs for runs and hits (21).
St. Louis had at least 20 hits for the first time since totaling 23 at Cincinnati on Sept. 1, 2020.
Key Match Events: Jordan Walker went 5 for 5, including a long two-run homer in the fifth and an RBI single in the second.
Lars Nootbaar hit a bases-clearing two-strike double in the seventh and added a two-run homer in the ninth.
Victor Scott II hit an RBI double and scored on a throwing error by reliever Phil Bickford.
Anthony Rizzo hit an RBI double to start a three-run fifth for the Yankees.
Alex Verdugo and Gleyber Torres hit run-scoring singles for the Yankees.
Anthony Volpe hit an RBI single and Torres lifted a tying sacrifice fly in the sixth.
Rookie Masyn Wynn hit a two-run double and Luken Baker hit a two-run homer in a four-run fourth for the Cardinals.
Giancarlo Stanton homered for the Yankees.
Post-Match Reflections: Jordan Walker expressed confidence in his abilities and was pleased with his five-hit performance.
St. Louis manager Oliver Marmol praised Walker's performance and enjoyment of the game.
New York manager Aaron Boone reflected on the inability to close out the inning and the impact of the five-run inning by the Cardinals.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was held at Yankee Stadium with an attendance of 42,768.
The game lasted 3 hours and 21 minutes.
Umpires for the game were Adam Beck (Home Plate), Dan Iassogna (First Base), CB Bucknor (Second Base), and Ben May (Third Base).
Others: Cardinals' LHP Steven Matz was activated after completing rehab from a back injury.
OF Michael Siani was activated after missing nearly a month with a strained right oblique.
Yankees' RHP Luis Gil threw 80 pitches in a rehab game for Double-A Somerset.
Yankees' RHP Clarke Schmidt will pitch in Somerset’s makeup game at Binghamton.
Yankees' RHP Ian Hamilton threw a bullpen session and will make a rehab appearance for Somerset.
